csharp_simple:
1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 public enum TripleBarrierLabel { Long = 1, Short = -1, Neutral = 0 }
7​
8 /// <summary>
9 /// Triple Barrier Labeling
10 /// </summary>
11 /// <remarks>
12 /// A technique for labeling financial data for Machine Learning.
13 /// <list type="bullet">
14 /// <item><description>Defines three barriers: Upper (Profit Take), Lower (Stop Loss), and Vertical (Time Limit).</description></item>
15 /// <item><description>Returns 1 if Upper hit first, -1 if Lower hit first, 0 if Time Limit reached.</description></item>
16 /// </list>
17 /// </remarks>
18 public class TripleBarrierLabelingFeature
19 {
20 public decimal UpperBarrier { get; }
21 public decimal LowerBarrier { get; }
22 public int MaxHoldingPeriod { get; }
23 public List<TripleBarrierLabel> Labels { get; } = new();
24​
25 public TripleBarrierLabelingFeature(decimal upperBarrier = 0.02m, decimal lowerBarrier = 0.02m, int maxHoldingPeriod = 10)
26 {
27 if (maxHoldingPeriod <= 0) throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(maxHoldingPeriod));
28 UpperBarrier = upperBarrier;
29 LowerBarrier = lowerBarrier;
30 MaxHoldingPeriod = maxHoldingPeriod;
31 }
32​
33 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
34 {
35 Labels.Clear();
36 var c = new List<CandleData>(candles);
37 if (c.Count == 0) return;
38​
39 for (int i = 0; i < c.Count; i++)
40 {
41 if (i + MaxHoldingPeriod >= c.Count)
42 {
43 Labels.Add(TripleBarrierLabel.Neutral);
44 continue; // Not enough future data
45 }
46​
47 decimal entryPrice = c[i].Close;
48 decimal upperTarget = entryPrice * (1 + UpperBarrier);
49 decimal lowerTarget = entryPrice * (1 - LowerBarrier);
50​
51 TripleBarrierLabel label = TripleBarrierLabel.Neutral;
52​
53 // Check future candles
54 for (int j = 1; j <= MaxHoldingPeriod && i + j < c.Count; j++)
55 {
56 if (c[i + j].High >= upperTarget)
57 {
58 label = TripleBarrierLabel.Long;
59 break;
60 }
61 if (c[i + j].Low <= lowerTarget)
62 {
63 label = TripleBarrierLabel.Short;
64 break;
65 }
66 }
67​
68 Labels.Add(label);
69 }
70 }
71​
72 public static List<TripleBarrierLabel> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, decimal upper = 0.02m, decimal lower = 0.02m, int holdPeriod = 10)
73 {
74 var feature = new TripleBarrierLabelingFeature(upper, lower, holdPeriod);
75 feature.Calculate(candles);
76 return feature.Labels;
77 }
78 }
79}
csharp_detailed:
1// =============================================================================
2// TRIPLE BARRIER LABELING FEATURE - Extreme Tutorial Mode
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// [What] Triple Barrier Labeling is a machine learning feature engineering
6// technique proposed by Marcos López de Prado. It labels price bars
7// based on which of three "barriers" is touched first: profit target,
8// stop loss, or time expiration.
9//
10// [Why] Traditional labeling (e.g., "next close > current close") is noisy.
11// Triple Barrier creates cleaner labels by:
12// - Defining clear profit/loss thresholds
13// - Limiting holding period (time barrier)
14// - Creating more actionable trading signals
15//
16// [Visual] The Three Barriers Concept:
17//
18// ─────────────────────── Upper Barrier (+2%) → LONG (profit hit)
19// ╱╲ ╱╲
20// ╱ ╲╱ Entry Price
21// ╱
22// ─────────────────────── Lower Barrier (-2%) → SHORT (stop hit)
23//
24// │←─── Max Holding Period ───→│ Time Barrier → NEUTRAL
25//
26// Whichever barrier is touched FIRST determines the label.
27//
28// [How] Algorithm Overview:
29//
30// ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
31// │ For each entry bar: │
32// │ 1. Set upper target = Entry × (1 + UpperBarrier) │
33// │ 2. Set lower target = Entry × (1 - LowerBarrier) │
34// │ 3. Look forward up to MaxHoldingPeriod bars │
35// │ 4. If High touches upper → Label = LONG (1) │
36// │ If Low touches lower → Label = SHORT (-1) │
37// │ If time expires → Label = NEUTRAL (0) │
38// └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
39//
40// =============================================================================
41​
42using System;
43using System.Collections.Generic;
44​
45namespace TechnicalIndicators
46{
47 // =========================================================================
48 // [What] CandleData: Immutable record for OHLCV price bar data
49 // =========================================================================
50 public readonly record struct CandleData(DateTime Timestamp, decimal Open, decimal High, decimal Low, decimal Close, long Volume);
51​
52 // =========================================================================
53 // [What] TripleBarrierLabel: Enum for trade outcome labels
54 // =========================================================================
55 //
56 // [Values]
57 // Long (1): Upper barrier hit first → Bullish outcome
58 // Short (-1): Lower barrier hit first → Bearish outcome
59 // Neutral (0): Time expired or insufficient data
60 //
61 public enum TripleBarrierLabel { Long = 1, Short = -1, Neutral = 0 }
62​
63 // =========================================================================
64 // [What] TripleBarrierLabelingFeature Class: ML label generator
65 // =========================================================================
66 public class TripleBarrierLabelingFeature
67 {
68 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
69 // [What] UpperBarrier: Profit target as decimal (0.02 = 2%)
70 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
71 public decimal UpperBarrier { get; }
72​
73 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
74 // [What] LowerBarrier: Stop loss threshold as decimal (0.02 = 2%)
75 // [Note] Stored as positive; applied as negative in calculation
76 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
77 public decimal LowerBarrier { get; }
78​
79 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
80 // [What] MaxHoldingPeriod: Maximum bars to hold position
81 // [Why] Limits exposure time; creates time barrier for labeling
82 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
83 public int MaxHoldingPeriod { get; }
84​
85 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
86 // [What] Labels: Generated trade outcome labels for each bar
87 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
88 public List<TripleBarrierLabel> Labels { get; } = new();
89​
90 // =====================================================================
91 // [What] Constructor: Initialize with barrier parameters
92 // =====================================================================
93 public TripleBarrierLabelingFeature(decimal upperBarrier = 0.02m, decimal lowerBarrier = 0.02m, int maxHoldingPeriod = 10)
94 {
95 if (maxHoldingPeriod <= 0) throw new ArgumentOutOfRangeException(nameof(maxHoldingPeriod));
96 UpperBarrier = upperBarrier;
97 LowerBarrier = lowerBarrier;
98 MaxHoldingPeriod = maxHoldingPeriod;
99 }
100​
101 // =====================================================================
102 // [What] Calculate: Generate labels for all entry points
103 // =====================================================================
104 //
105 // [IPO Block]
106 // ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
107 // │ INPUT: candles - Collection of OHLCV price bars │
108 // │ PROCESS: For each bar, check which barrier is touched first │
109 // │ OUTPUT: Labels list with trade outcome for each entry │
110 // └──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
111 //
112 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
113 {
114 Labels.Clear();
115 var c = new List<CandleData>(candles);
116 if (c.Count == 0) return;
117​
118 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
119 // [What] Process each bar as potential entry point
120 //
121 // [Visual] Label Assignment for Entry at Bar i:
122 //
123 // Bar: i i+1 i+2 i+3 i+4 ... i+MaxHold
124 // Entry ─┬────────────────────────┤
125 // │ │
126 // ═══════╪════════════════════════╪═══ Upper (Long)
127 // │ ╱╲ │
128 // │ ╱ ╲╱╲ │
129 // ═══════╪════════════════════════╪═══ Lower (Short)
130 // │ │
131 // └── First hit wins ──────┤
132 //
133 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
134 for (int i = 0; i < c.Count; i++)
135 {
136 // -------------------------------------------------------------
137 // [What] Handle end-of-data: Not enough future bars
138 // [Why] Need MaxHoldingPeriod bars to look forward
139 // -------------------------------------------------------------
140 if (i + MaxHoldingPeriod >= c.Count)
141 {
142 Labels.Add(TripleBarrierLabel.Neutral);
143 continue;
144 }
145​
146 // -------------------------------------------------------------
147 // [What] Calculate barrier price levels
148 //
149 // [Example] Entry = 100, UpperBarrier = 0.02, LowerBarrier = 0.02
150 // upperTarget = 100 × 1.02 = 102
151 // lowerTarget = 100 × 0.98 = 98
152 // -------------------------------------------------------------
153 decimal entryPrice = c[i].Close;
154 decimal upperTarget = entryPrice * (1 + UpperBarrier);
155 decimal lowerTarget = entryPrice * (1 - LowerBarrier);
156​
157 TripleBarrierLabel label = TripleBarrierLabel.Neutral;
158​
159 // -------------------------------------------------------------
160 // [What] Look forward to find first barrier touch
161 //
162 // [Logic]
163 // Check each future bar in sequence.
164 // If High >= upperTarget: Upper barrier touched → LONG
165 // If Low <= lowerTarget: Lower barrier touched → SHORT
166 // First touch wins; order matters!
167 //
168 // [Visual] Barrier Check per Bar:
169 // Bar j: High=103, Low=99
170 // Upper=102: 103 >= 102? YES → LONG!
171 // (Lower not checked because Upper hit first)
172 // -------------------------------------------------------------
173 for (int j = 1; j <= MaxHoldingPeriod && i + j < c.Count; j++)
174 {
175 // Check if High touches upper barrier (profit target)
176 if (c[i + j].High >= upperTarget)
177 {
178 label = TripleBarrierLabel.Long;
179 break;
180 }
181 // Check if Low touches lower barrier (stop loss)
182 if (c[i + j].Low <= lowerTarget)
183 {
184 label = TripleBarrierLabel.Short;
185 break;
186 }
187 }
188 // If loop completes without break, label remains NEUTRAL (time barrier)
189​
190 Labels.Add(label);
191 }
192 }
193​
194 // =====================================================================
195 // [What] Calculate: Static convenience method
196 // =====================================================================
197 //
198 // [IPO Block]
199 // ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
200 // │ INPUT: candles, barrier thresholds, holding period │
201 // │ PROCESS: Create instance, calculate, return labels │
202 // │ OUTPUT: List of TripleBarrierLabel for each entry │
203 // └──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
204 //
205 public static List<TripleBarrierLabel> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, decimal upper = 0.02m, decimal lower = 0.02m, int holdPeriod = 10)
206 {
207 var feature = new TripleBarrierLabelingFeature(upper, lower, holdPeriod);
208 feature.Calculate(candles);
209 return feature.Labels;
210 }
211 }
212}
python_simple:
1class TripleBarrierLabelingFeature:
2 """
3 Triple Barrier
4 """
5 def __init__(self, upper=0.02, lower=0.02, hold=10):
6 self.upper = upper
7 self.lower = lower
8 self.hold = hold
9 self.labels = [] # 1, -1, 0
10​
11 def calculate(self, candles):
12 self.labels.clear()
13 if not candles: return
14​
15 count = len(candles)
16 for i in range(count):
17 if i + self.hold >= count:
18 self.labels.append(0) # Neutral/Unknown
19 continue
20​
21 entry = float(candles[i]['close'])
22 up_target = entry * (1 + self.upper)
23 down_target = entry * (1 - self.lower)
24
25 label = 0
26
27 for j in range(1, self.hold + 1):
28 idx = i + j
29 if idx >= count: break
30
31 h = float(candles[idx]['high'])
32 l = float(candles[idx]['low'])
33
34 if h >= up_target:
35 label = 1 # Long
36 break
37 if l <= down_target:
38 label = -1 # Short
39 break
40
41 self.labels.append(label)
42​
43def calculate(candles, upper=0.02, lower=0.02, hold=10):
44 obj = TripleBarrierLabelingFeature(upper, lower, hold)
45 obj.calculate(candles)
46 return obj.labels
python_detailed:
1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (Triple Barrier Labeling Feature)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# Triple Barrier Labeling Feature.
7#
8# [Core Concepts]
9# 1. Machine Learning Feature
10# - This code is NOT a trading signal itself.
11# - It is used to generate "Ground Truth" labels regarding what happened
12# after a specific bar. This label (1, -1, 0) is then fed into an ML model
13# as the Target Variable to train it.
14#
15# 2. The Three Barriers
16# - Barrier 1 (Upper Horizontal): Profit Taking. Label = 1 (Long Win).
17# - Barrier 2 (Lower Horizontal): Stop Loss. Label = -1 (Short Win).
18# - Barrier 3 (Vertical): Time limit. Label = 0 (Time Expired/Neutral).
19#
20# 3. Path Dependency
21# - Just because price hits the Upper Barrier eventually doesn't mean it's a win.
22# - It might have hit the Lower Barrier (Stop Loss) FIRST.
23# - This logic simulates a realistic trade lifecycle.
24#
25# =============================================================================
26​
27# -------------------------------------------------------------
28# Type-Level Explanation: TripleBarrierLabelingFeature (class)
29#
30# [Why] Standard ML Financial Data Labeling (Prof. Lopez de Prado).
31# [What] Outcome Classifier.
32# [How] Simulates a theoretical trade with profit/stop constraints to label historical data.
33# -------------------------------------------------------------
34class TripleBarrierLabelingFeature:
35 # Constants for Code Clarity
36 LONG_WIN = 1
37 SHORT_WIN = -1
38 NEUTRAL = 0
39​
40 # -------------------------------------------------------------
41 # Constructor: __init__
42 # [Why] Define the rules of the "Game" (Trade).
43 # -------------------------------------------------------------
44 def __init__(self, upper_barrier=0.02, lower_barrier=0.02, max_holding_period=10):
45 if max_holding_period <= 0:
46 raise ValueError("max_holding_period must be > 0")
47
48 # Target % (e.g., 0.02 = 2%)
49 self.upper_barrier = upper_barrier
50 self.lower_barrier = lower_barrier
51
52 # Max bars to hold position
53 self.max_holding_period = max_holding_period
54
55 self.labels = [] # Result storage
56​
57 # =============================================================================
58 # IPO: calculate
59 # =============================================================================
60 #
61 # [Input]
62 # - candles: List[dict]
63 #
64 # [Process]
65 # 1. Loop through every candle (treating it as a potential Entry).
66 # 2. Derive Targets (Entry + 2%, Entry - 2%).
67 # 3. Simulate future path:
68 # - Loop J from 1 to MaxHolding.
69 # - Check High vs UpperTarget (Win?).
70 # - Check Low vs LowerTarget (Loss?).
71 # - First event dictates label.
72 # 4. If neither hit by J=Max, label 0.
73 #
74 # [Output]
75 # - None.
76 # =============================================================================
77 def calculate(self, candles):
78
79 # -------------------------------------------------------------
80 # Logic Step 1: Reset
81 # -------------------------------------------------------------
82 self.labels.clear()
83 if len(candles) == 0:
84 return
85​
86 # -------------------------------------------------------------
87 # Logic Step 2: Main Entry Loop
88 # -------------------------------------------------------------
89 for i in range(len(candles)):
90
91 # Logic Step 2.1: Check Data Availability
92 # [Why] Cannot look ahead if the future does not exist yet.
93 # If we don't have 'max_holding_period' bars left, we can't truly label it.
94 # Decision: Label as Neutral (0) or skip? We usually label 0.
95 if i + self.max_holding_period >= len(candles):
96 self.labels.append(self.NEUTRAL)
97 continue
98​
99 entry_price = candles[i]['close']
100
101 # Calculate Absolute Price Targets
102 upper_target_price = entry_price * (1.0 + self.upper_barrier)
103 lower_target_price = entry_price * (1.0 - self.lower_barrier)
104
105 # Default Outcome: Time Expired (Neutral)
106 final_label = self.NEUTRAL
107
108 # ---------------------------------------------------------
109 # Logic Step 3: Look-Ahead Simulation
110 # [Why] Path dependency check (What happens first?)
111 # [How] Iterate forward bar-by-bar to check barriers.
112 # ---------------------------------------------------------
113 for j in range(1, self.max_holding_period + 1):
114 # Future Index
115 future_idx = i + j
116
117 # Check Bounds (Safety, though Step 2.1 covers mainly)
118 if future_idx >= len(candles):
119 break
120
121 future_high = candles[future_idx]['high']
122 future_low = candles[future_idx]['low']
123
124 # Check Barriers
125 # Note: Logic here handles the "Double Touch" ambiguity.
126 # If High hits Upper AND Low hits Lower in same bar:
127 # Which happened first? We don't have intraday data here.
128 # Convention: Usually Pessimistic (Stop Loss assumed hit first).
129 # But basic version: Check Targets.
130
131 hit_upper = (future_high >= upper_target_price)
132 hit_lower = (future_low <= lower_target_price)
133
134 if hit_lower:
135 # Stop Loss Hit
136 final_label = self.SHORT_WIN # Or "Long Loss". Value is -1.
137 break
138 elif hit_upper:
139 # Profit Target Hit
140 final_label = self.LONG_WIN
141 break
142
143 # ---------------------------------------------------------
144 # Logic Step 4: Store Result
145 # ---------------------------------------------------------
146 self.labels.append(final_label)
147​
148​
149# =============================================================================
150# Static Wrapper Function
151# =============================================================================
152def calculate(candles, upper=0.02, lower=0.02, hold_period=10):
153 feature = TripleBarrierLabelingFeature(upper, lower, hold_period)
154 feature.calculate(candles)
155 return feature.labels
